lead_paragraph: An article on Friday about the Pittsburgh Penguins’ star-powered success this season attributed an erroneous distinction to the outdoor game the team played against Buffalo in January. It was the second regular-season N.H.L. game to be played outdoors — not the first, which was in Edmonton, Alberta, in November 2003.
